com.stormpath.sdk.query

Interface Criteria<T extends Criteria<T>>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AccountCriteria, AccountStoreMappingCriteria, ApplicationCriteria, DirectoryCriteria, GroupCriteria

    public interface Criteria<T extends Criteria<T>>
    A Criteria instance represents one or more Criterion (conditions) that are used to customize query results.
    Since:
    0.8
    See Also:
    AccountCriteria, GroupCriteria, DirectoryCriteria, ApplicationCriteria

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T add(Criterion c)
      Adds a Criterion to the total set of criteria (conditions), further restricting how the query executes.
      T and(Criterion c)
      Adds an 'and' condition (a conjunction) to the total set of criteria (conditions), further restricting how the query executes.
      T ascending()
      Indicates the immediately preceding orderBy clause should indicate ascending order.
      T descending()
      Indicates the immediately preceding orderBy clause should indicate descending order.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if this instance does not yet reflect any criteria conditions or orderBy statements, false otherwise.
      T limitTo(int limit)
      Sets the query's page size limit: the maximum number of results to include in a single page.
      T offsetBy(int offset)
      Sets the query's pagination offset: the index in the overall result set of matching resources that should be considered the first item to include in the response 'page'.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        T add(Criterion c)
        Adds a Criterion to the total set of criteria (conditions), further restricting how the query executes.

        In practice, this is merely an alias for the and(Criterion) method.

        Parameters:
        c - the criterion (condition) to add
        Returns:
        the criteria instance for method chaining

      • and

        T and(Criterion c)
        Adds an 'and' condition (a conjunction) to the total set of criteria (conditions), further restricting how the query executes.
        Parameters:
        c - the criterion (condition) to 'and' with any other existing criteria
        Returns:
        the criteria instance for method chaining

      • ascending

        T ascending()
                                throws IllegalStateException
        Indicates the immediately preceding orderBy clause should indicate ascending order. This is the default for all orderBy clauses and is not required to be invoked. For example, the following are functionally equivalent: 

         ...orderByGivenName()

 ...orderByGivenName().ascending()

        Usage Note: calling this method without first calling an orderBy method immediately before this one will result in an IllegalStateException. For example, this is valid: 

         ...orderByGivenName().ascending()
        but this is not valid: 
         ...and(name().containsIgnoreCase("foo").ascending()
        The second ascending() invocation did not immediately follow an orderBy clause.
        Returns:
        the criteria instance for method chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called without first calling an orderBy method immediately before this one.

      • descending

        T descending()
        Indicates the immediately preceding orderBy clause should indicate descending order. For example: equivalent: 

         ...orderBySurname().descending()

        Usage Note: calling this method without first calling an orderBy method immediately before this one will result in an IllegalStateException. For example, this is valid: 

         ...orderBySurname().descending()
        but this is not valid: 
         ...and(name().containsIgnoreCase("foo").descending()
        The second descending() invocation did not immediately follow an orderBy clause.
        Returns:
        the criteria instance for method chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called without first calling an orderBy method immediately before this one.

      • offsetBy

        T offsetBy(int offset)
        Sets the query's pagination offset: the index in the overall result set of matching resources that should be considered the first item to include in the response 'page'. All subsequent resources in the response page will immediately follow this index.

        For example, a paged query with an offset of 50 will return a page of results where the page contains resource at index 50, then the resource at index 51, then at 52, 53, etc.

        If unspecified, this number defaults to 0, indicating that the results should start at the first result in the overall set (i.e the first 'page'). The maximum number of elements returned in a page is specified by the limitTo(int) method.

        Parameters:
        offset - the query's pagination offset: the index in the overall result set of matching resources that should be considered the first item to include in the response 'page'.
        Returns:
        the criteria instance for method chaining
        See Also:
        limitTo(int)

      • limitTo

        T limitTo(int limit)
        Sets the query's page size limit: the maximum number of results to include in a single page. If unspecified, this number defaults to 25. The minimum number allowed is 1, the maximum is 100.
        Parameters:
        limit - the query's page size limit: the maximum number of results to include in a single page.
        Returns:
        the criteria instance for method chaining
        See Also:
        offsetBy(int)

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this instance does not yet reflect any criteria conditions or orderBy statements, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if this instance does not yet reflect any criteria conditions or orderBy statements, false otherwise.
